definition: Sha Wujing
granule/hoarse/raspy/sand/powder/CL:粒[li4]/abbr. for Tsar or Tsarist Russia
surname Sha
monk/Sangha, the Buddhist monastic order

sentences.english: I also fail to get work, own it Drifting.
sentences.chinese: 干活也轮不到我，自有那沙僧。

sentences.english: Drifting, how many people died in The liberation war?
sentences.chinese: 沙僧，解放战争死了多少人啊？

definition: Sha Wujing

Xuanzang (602-664) Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator, who traveled to India 629-645
the eight precepts (Buddhism)

Tripitaka (602-664), Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator who traveled to India 629-645/same as 玄奘
Sha Wujing, character from the Journey to the West
Erlangshen, Chinese deity
Zhu Bajie 豬八戒|猪八戒[Zhu1 Ba1 jie4] or Zhu Wuneng, Pigsy or Pig (in Journey to the West)

Journey to the West, Ming dynasty novel by Wu Cheng'en 吳承恩|吴承恩, one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature/also called Pilgrimage to the West or Monkey
